turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: It means I wasn't what everyone thought I was...  I was a fake.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Someone else can help you. Someone else can make you happy.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: We're not gonna start crying again, are we?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Maybe they wake up that morning thinking they have a thousand things to do and a thousand days left to do them in... And then all of a sudden, it's all taken away. No one asked them. It's just gone...

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: You have nice red in your cheeks now.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Do you know what 'Yo no quiero morir' is?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: It's Spanish. It means... 'I don't want to die.'  Not all the ghosts are scary, are they? Like Mrs. Marschal?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: What do those ghosts want when they talk to you? Think real careful now, Cole...

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Yes! I think that's right!... I think they all want that. Even the scary ones...

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I believe both of you now.  And I think I might know how to make them go away.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: What if they don't want help? What if they're just angry and they want to hurt somebody?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I don't think that's the way it works, Cole.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: She came a long way to visit me, didn't she?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I wish I were somewhere else.

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: Where will you go, where no one has died?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: I think we said everything we needed to say.  Maybe it's time to say things to someone else? Someone close to you?

turns.speaker: MALCOLM
turns.text: You were great in the play, Cole.

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: It was Grandma's. It's not for playing.  What if it broke? You know how sad I'd be.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: You'd cry. Cause you miss grandma so much.

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: That's right. So why do you take it, sweetheart?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Sometimes people think they lose things and they didn't really lose them. It just gets moved.

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: Did you move the bumble bee pendant?

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: You didn't take it before. You didn't take it the time after that. And now, you didn't take it again?

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: There's only two of us.  Maybe someone came in our house -- took the bumble bee pendant out of my closet, and then laid it nicely in your drawer?  Is that what happened?

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: I'd give anything to have been there.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I'm ready to communicate with you now.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: You know that accident up there?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: They want me to do things for them.

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: I would never think that about you... ever... Got it?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: She says she's sorry for taking the bumble bee pendant. She just likes it a lot.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Grandma comes to visit me sometimes.

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: Cole, that's very wrong. Grandma's gone. You know that.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: She wanted me to tell you--

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: She wanted me to tell you, she saw you dance.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: They used to hang people here.

turns.speaker: MR. CUNNINGHAM
turns.text: That's not correct. Where'd you hear that?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: They'd pull the people in crying and kissing their families bye... People watching would spit at them.

turns.speaker: MR. CUNNINGHAM
turns.text: Cole, this was a legal courthouse. Laws were passed here. Some of the first laws of this country. This building was full of lawyers. Lawmakers.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: They were the ones who hanged everybody.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I don't like people looking at me like that.

turns.speaker: MR. CUNNINGHAM
turns.text: I don't know how else to look--

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: You talked funny when you went to school here. You talked funny all the way to high school!

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: You shouldn't laugh at people. It makes them feel bad.

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: The last time was a Chuck E. Cheese party a year ago. He hid in one of those purple plastic tunnels and didn't come out.

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: I work at an insurance place and at Penny's, so Cole can go to that good school.

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: I wish I could be like my momma though. She always knew what was wrong. Knew just what to say.

turns.speaker: BILLY BOB
turns.text: Your pa's waiting for you up at the house.

turns.speaker: BILLY BOB
turns.text: 'Course, some folks say 'ol Jethro shouldn't have been buried up here... with the rest of the Macdonalds.

turns.speaker: BILLY BOB
turns.text: Hell, he was your grandfather. You know what he did.

turns.speaker: BILLY BOB
turns.text: Maybe you don't want to remember.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Let's say today, we make it your business.

turns.speaker: BILLY BOB
turns.text: You ever hear of... the harvest of blood?

turns.speaker: BILLY BOB
turns.text: Your grandfather sure believed in it. Worked pretty good... too.

turns.speaker: BILLY BOB
turns.text: ...Chicken blood? Who said it was... "chicken blood"?

turns.speaker: BILLY BOB
turns.text: I'd watch your step if I were you, son.

turns.speaker: BILLY BOB
turns.text: Just talked to Orwell down at the garage. Says getting a new alternator for your bus is no problem.

turns.speaker: BILLY BOB
turns.text: Could take a little while, though.

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: Yo. "Billy Bob". Was I two beats behind, or what?

turns.speaker: BILLY BOB
turns.text: You were a beat and a quarter behind.

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: Fuck you! If you're such an expert on music, why don't you go get your dueling banjo and sit in on the next song?

turns.speaker: BILLY BOB
turns.text: I ain't never played a banjo in my life.

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: Okay, Farm Boy. Joke's over. You've been playin' me from jump street. Where's my Nikes?

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: Listen to me, you banjo-dueling, country ass hayseed... I want my Nikes and I want them now!

turns.speaker: BILLY BOB
turns.text: You... think... I... stole... your... fancy shoes? I... wouldn't... be... caught... dead in 'em.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Where'd you come from? Groupies R Us?

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Hey! Don't use all the hot water!

turns.speaker: CANDY
turns.text: Keep your shirt on! I'm almost done!

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Let me guess. We're going on a "long trip".

turns.speaker: CANDY
turns.text: Rod... I have to get back to my job.

turns.speaker: CANDY
turns.text: I happen to be a professional.

turns.speaker: CANDY
turns.text: You have a strong unfufilled desire.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Yeah. To get the hell off this farm.

turns.speaker: CANDY
turns.text: No. This is something spiritual. An ambition.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: The hell with this.  I'm coming back up!!!

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Yeah. It's the alternator all right.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: How would you know? You're looking at my tits.  Jesus, Carl. Your job is to keep us on the road!

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Find out what's holding things up. I want to get the hell off this farm.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: There's something weird going on here, Suzie.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: I'm serious. Get this. I had a careful look at that alternator. It's clearly been messed with... it's not wear and tear that caused that breakdown...

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: You're saying someone's trying to keep us on the farm...?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Suzie, face it. The only "axe" he's picked up since we came here... is a real one. He doesn't give a damn about the band anymore... or about you.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: You need someone who can protect you, Suzie.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: He should turn that music down. Jeremiah's gonna kill him.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Missed you at church this morning, Jeremiah.

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: You're not going to arrest me for it, are you?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Hell, no. But you missed a damn good sermon. "You can't hide a wicked heart from the eyes of the Lord."

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Thought your boy and his band were only staying the night.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: You know, one day I'm going to have to shut down that still of yours, Jeremiah.

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: Well, why don't you hold these as evidence in the meantime.

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: Motherfucking soundman! I couldn't hear myself sing!

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: Okay. My main man. Marvin Gaye.

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: Wait a second. Did you say "patricide?"

turns.speaker: IAN
turns.text: Yeah. Marvin's old man gunned him down.

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: That's not patricide. Patricide is when you gun down your old man.

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: Wrong. Fratricide is when you gun down your brother. You're out. My turn.

turns.speaker: IAN
turns.text: Fine. Be that way. Jim Morrison.

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: Died in the bathtub... if, in fact, he's really dead. Next.

turns.speaker: IAN
turns.text: Two hundred bucks?? Are you crazy?

turns.speaker: KEITH
turns.text: Damn! These are one hundred dollar Nikes!

turns.speaker: IAN
turns.text: I thought you said two hundred.

turns.speaker: IAN
turns.text: Well, there goes our record deal.

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: Nah. We still got Billy Bob.

turns.speaker: IAN
turns.text: You're out of your mind, man.

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: I am not! I'm telling you, it's worth its weight in gold.

turns.speaker: IAN
turns.text: Let me get this straight... we're talking about manure?

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: The ancient Aztecs knew how powerful this stuff was.

turns.speaker: IAN
turns.text: Cowshit? Are you sure the Aztecs even had cows?

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: Sprinkled a pinch of manure in there just before I rolled it.

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: It harvests! It threshes! Look at these blades.

turns.speaker: IAN
turns.text: Should we be doing this, dude?

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: Yeah, man. You were wrong, Suze. My solo definitely works better in the second verse.

turns.speaker: IAN
turns.text: Come out, come out wherever you are!

turns.speaker: ROD
turns.text: We've got to call someone -- get the sheriff--

turns.speaker: IAN
turns.text: The Sheriff?! We don't need the sheriff!!! We need to get the hell out of here!

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: What are you going to do? Shoot me?

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: Depends. You got some nerve intruding on a man's grief. I bet I could pull this trigger right now and call it justifiable homicide. Now: who are you?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You know who I am. You invited me.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I'm your son. And Laureen's son.

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: Ain't nobody mentioned that name on this farm for 14 years. My boy was taken from me... far as I'm concerned, he's dead. Now, I ain't gonna ask you again. -- Who are you?!

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: Joseph Macdonald. Damn right, boy. And don't you forget it.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I came back for the funeral. That's all.

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: Broke her heart you never visited... But I always said you'd come back.

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: ...Guess it was her time to go. You can't argue... when the good Lord calls you home.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Aunt Edith. How did she... die?

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: That old barn. After the fire... I rebuilt it nail by nail. Just the way your granddaddy would've wanted it.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: This is his room... isn't it?

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: Was. You ain't afraid of ghosts, now are you?

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: You got it wrong, boy. I'm not the monster you think.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Maybe you should tell that to the old lady you tried to hit with the shovel.

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: I wouldn't pay Jesse no mind at all. She's just a crazy old woman. Hasn't been right in the head since her husband passed away.  Wasn't much right before that, neither.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: She was talking about... a "harvest of blood"...

turns.speaker: JEREMIAH
turns.text: Old slave superstition. You sprinkle a little blood mixed with water on the crops, you get yourself a good harvest... So they say.
